commitResults.messageBody:
Add the ability to store whatever text entered by the user and
display them back to the user when requested.
Add the ability to mark tasks as done.

Add support for tracking three types of tasks:

ToDos: tasks without any date/time attached to it e.g., visit new
theme park
Deadlines: tasks that need to be done before a specific date/time
e.g., submit report by 11/10/2019 5pm
Events: tasks that start at a specific time and ends at a
specific time e.g., team project meeting on 2/10/2019 2-4pm

Use the input/output redirection technique to semi-automate the
testing of Duke.

Teach Duke to deal with errors such as incorrect inputs entered
by the user.
Add support for deleting tasks from the list.

Program is unable to save.

The ability to save is vitally important for a user to be able to
remember their tasks.

Let's add the ability to save

commitResults.messageTitle: Make Storage class do processing of data
commitResults.messageBody:
When loading the data, the Storage class does not do any
processing of the data and simply passes the file

Processing of the data is a job that should be done by the
Storage class

Have the Storage class process the data before passing it over

Program dates are simply stored as strings with no ability for
manipulation

Understanding dates is important for functionality such as
listing tasks on a particular day

Dates are now parsed as LocalDate objects

Program has bugs due to the merge

Bugs must be fixed for the program to work

The bugs are fixed

Roles of classes are not well defined

Code is not OOP enough

Refactor the code to extract out closely related code as classes.

Classes are not packaged

Classes are unorganized

Organize classes by putting them into packages

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JUnit tests to test the behavior of the code.
commitResults.messageBody:
Testing is being done manually.

Automating tests allows for more consistency and speed up the
testing workflow

Tests have been implemented with JUnit

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix bug when packaged in Jar file
commitResults.messageBody:
Program does not run from Jar file due to a bug

Get the program to run from jar

Fix the bug

No JavaDocs

Not having JavaDocs makes it difficult for other programmers to
understand the code

JavaDocs are added

commitResults.messageTitle: Tweak the code to comply with the coding standard
commitResults.messageBody:
Code does not comply with the coding standard

Code does not look consistent

Tweak the code to comply with the coding standard

commitResults.messageTitle: Find a task by searching for a keyword
commitResults.messageBody:
Program does not support finding tasks relevant to a keyword

Tedious to read through all the tasks in the list to find related
tasks

Added functionality to search through list for tasks with the
keyword

project does not use Gradle

Automate project builds using Gradle

Project uses Gradle

Duke runs on the command line

Command line is not user-friendly

Use the JavaFX technology to implement a GUI

Coding violations have to be checked manually

Checkstyle can help spot coding violations automatically
